title.narrative: F.a: Participatory School Governance for Children (PSGC)

description.narrative: The programme aims to increase participation by students especially those from marginalised and excluded groups, and their parents / caregivers in school affairs and management for equitable access to quality education. The programme builds the capacity of student councils, school management committees and education officials on school governance and accountability. In Uganda over 90% of children enter primary school but over 50% of students who enroll in primary one either repeat classes or drop out before completing the full seven years, more so girls and children with disabilities. Besides low completion rate, the quality of learning outcomes is equally poor meaning that children are going to school but not actually learning. The current national school g overnance system described in the education laws emphasizes community participation in school governance but with little emphasis to the role of the learners. Increased participation leads to reduced teacher and pupil absenteeism, joint planning and usage of funds, improved capacity to support the work of the schools and finally to improved learning and teaching outcomes. The programme is implemented by Plan Uganda together with education officials and communities.
